puzzle.help: 1. Divide the board into areas (Tatami). 2. Every Tatami must be exactly one cell wide and can be of length from 1 to 4 cells. 3. A cell with a number indicates the length of the Tatami. Not all Tatamis have to be marked by a number. 4. Two Tatamis of the same size must not be orthogonally adjacent. 5. A grid dot must not be shared by the corners of four Tatamis (lines can't form 4-way crosses).
